com.esotericsoftware.kryo

Class Serializer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.esotericsoftware.kryo.Serializer<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArraySerializer, BeanSerializer, BlowfishSerializer, CollectionSerializer, DefaultSerializers.BigDecimalSerializer, DefaultSerializers.BigIntegerSerializer, DefaultSerializers.BooleanSerializer, DefaultSerializers.ByteArraySerializer, DefaultSerializers.ByteSerializer, DefaultSerializers.CharSerializer, DefaultSerializers.ClassSerializer, DefaultSerializers.CollectionsEmptyListSerializer, DefaultSerializers.CollectionsEmptyMapSerializer, DefaultSerializers.CollectionsEmptySetSerializer, DefaultSerializers.CollectionsSingletonListSerializer, DefaultSerializers.CollectionsSingletonMapSerializer, DefaultSerializers.CollectionsSingletonSetSerializer, DefaultSerializers.CurrencySerializer, DefaultSerializers.DateSerializer, DefaultSerializers.DoubleSerializer, DefaultSerializers.EnumSerializer, DefaultSerializers.FloatSerializer, DefaultSerializers.IntSerializer, DefaultSerializers.KryoSerializableSerializer, DefaultSerializers.LongSerializer, DefaultSerializers.ShortSerializer, DefaultSerializers.StringBufferSerializer, DefaultSerializers.StringBuilderSerializer, DefaultSerializers.StringSerializer, DeflateSerializer, FieldSerializer, FieldSerializerTest.HasDefaultSerializerAnnotationSerializer, JavaSerializer, MapSerializer

    public abstract class Serializer<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Reads and writes objects to and from bytes.
    Author:
    Nathan Sweet

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public abstract void write(Kryo kryo,
         Output output,
         T object)
        Writes the bytes for the object to the output.

        This method should not be called directly, instead this serializer can be passed to Kryo write methods that accept a serialier.

        Parameters:
        object - May be null if getAcceptsNull() is true.

      • create

        public T create(Kryo kryo,
       Input input,
       java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Creates a new object of the specified type. The object may be uninitialized. This method may read from input to populate the object, but it must not call Kryo methods to deserialize nested objects. That must be done in read(Kryo, Input, Object). The default implementation uses Kryo.newInstance(Class) to create a new object.

        This method should not be called directly, instead this serializer can be passed to Kryo read methods that accept a serialier.

        Returns:
        May be null if getAcceptsNull() is true.

      • read

        public void read(Kryo kryo,
        Input input,
        T object)
        Populates the object. This method may call Kryo methods to deserialize nested objects, unlike create(Kryo, Input, Class). The default implementation is empty.

        Any serializer that uses Kryo to serialize a nested object may need to be reentrant.

        This method should not be called directly, instead this serializer can be passed to Kryo read methods that accept a serialier.

      • getAcceptsNull

        public boolean getAcceptsNull()

      • setAcceptsNull

        public void setAcceptsNull(boolean acceptsNull)
        If true, this serializer will handle writing and reading null values. If false, the Kryo framework handles null values.

      • isImmutable

        public boolean isImmutable()

      • setImmutable

        public void setImmutable(boolean immutable)
        If true, createCopy(Kryo, Object) will return the original object.

      • createCopy

        public T createCopy(Kryo kryo,
           T original)
        Creates a copy of the specified object. The object may be uninitialized or this method may populate the copy, but it must not call Kryo methods to copy nested objects. That must be done in copy(Kryo, Object, Object). The default implementation returns the original if isImmutable() is true, else throws KryoException. Subclasses should override this method if needed to support Kryo.copy(Object).

        This method should not be called directly, instead this serializer can be passed to Kryo copy methods that accept a serialier.

        Returns:
        May be null if getAcceptsNull() is true.

      • copy

        public void copy(Kryo kryo,
        T original,
        T copy)
        Configures the copy to have the same values as the original. This method may call Kryo methods to copy nested objects, unlike createCopy(Kryo, Object). The default implementation is empty.

        Any serializer that uses Kryo to copy a nested object may need to be reentrant. *

        This method should not be called directly, instead this serializer can be passed to Kryo copy methods that accept a serialier.
